data.title: Former Ducks player Luke Ridnour to be inducted into Pac-12 Hall of Honor
data.meta_description: Ridnour, who spent 12 seasons in the NBA with the Seattle SuperSonics, Milwaukee Bucks, Minnesota Timberwolves, Charlotte Bobcats and Orlando Magic, will be inducted on March 12 during a ceremony before the Pac-12 tournament championship game in Las
data.text:
Former Oregon basketball player Luke Ridnour, who was the 2003 Pac-12 Player of the Year, will be inducted into the Pac-12 Hall of Honor this year for his accomplishments with the Ducks from 2000-2003.

Ridnour, who spent 12 seasons in the NBA with the Seattle SuperSonics, Milwaukee Bucks, Minnesota Timberwolves, Charlotte Bobcats and Orlando Magic, will be inducted on March 12 during a ceremony before the Pac-12 tournament championship game in Las Vegas.

Also being inducted are Salim Stoudamire (Arizona), Art Becker (Arizona State), Brian Hendrick (California), Scott Wedman (Colorado), Jim Anderson (Oregon State), Kim Belton (Stanford), Keith Erickson (UCLA), Sam Clancy (USC), Vern Gardner (Utah), Isaiah Thomas (Washington) and Keith Morrison (Washington State).
